caption:
This aerial photograph showcases a rural landscape abundant with agricultural and natural features. The prevailing element in the image is the lush greenery, indicating a fertile region likely dedicated to farming and possibly forestry.

In the foreground, two prominent white structures, possibly farmhouses or barns, serve as focal points amidst the expansive scenery. These buildings stand out starkly against the rich greens and browns of the environment, suggesting a human presence integrated with the natural surroundings.

The terrain is a patchwork of different shades of green, indicating various crops or types of vegetation. Some fields are darker, likely indicating richer, possibly wetter soil or different crop types, while others are lighter, possibly freshly plowed or planted fields. This mixed-use pattern is typical of agricultural practices that rotate crops to maintain soil health.

The land is interspersed with wooded areas, showing dense tree coverage. These wooded patches could serve as windbreaks, wildlife habitats, and contribute to the ecological balance of the area.

In the distance, the landscape gradually flattens into broader fields under cultivation, with few visible trees. This transition suggests different land uses within the region, possibly changing agricultural techniques or crops as dictated by the terrain and soil characteristics.

Overall, the photograph captures a tranquil rural landscape marked by a harmonious balance between agricultural development and natural features. The elevated perspective emphasizes the vastness and variety of the terrain, highlighting both human endeavor and the natural environment's enduring presence.
title: Farmland. (From the sites exhibition. For other images in this assignment, see fiche numbers 80, 81, 82, 83.)
